title: Who is Afraid of Ideology? Part 4: Reverse Shot

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of single-channel video, color, sound, 35 min.; edition 3 of 5, plus 2 artist's proofs.

medium_display: Single-channel video, color, sound, 35 min.; edition 3 of 5, plus 2 artist's proofs
credit_line: Oscar L. Gerber Memorial Endowment Fund
publication_history:
Stephanie Bailey, "documenta fifteen is a sum of its parts, not a single event," Ocula, July 14, 2022 (color ill), https://ocula.com/magazine/features/documenta-fifteen-is-not-a-single-event/

Mariam Elnozahy, "Our Shared Future: Marwa Aarsanios' "Reverse Shot"," The Markaz Review, Nov. 28, 2022 (color ill.), https://themarkaz.org/our-shared-future-marwa-arsanios-reverse-shot/

Melissa Gronlund, "The top picks from Frieze London, from folklore to fundraisers," The National News, Oct. 13, 2022, https://www.thenationalnews.com/arts-culture/art/2022/10/13/the-top-picks-from-frieze-london-from-folklore-to-fundraisers/

Nadine Khalil, "The DIY Chaos of Documenta 15," Frieze, July 7, 2022, https://www.frieze.com/article/diy-chaos-documenta-15-2022-review

Siddhartha Mitter, "Critics Notebook: Documenta Was a Whole Bive. Then a Scandal Killed the Buzz," New York Time, July 5, 2022, https://www.nytimes.com/2022/06/24/arts/design/documenta-review.html

Ruangrupa, Documenta Fifteen Handbook, exh. cat. (Berlin: Hatje Cantz Verlag, 2022), 146 (color ill.), 147.
exhibition_history:
Kassel, Hafenstrasse 76, Documenta Fifteen, June 18-Sept. 25, 2022, no cat. no.

London, Mosaic Rooms, Marwa Arsanios: Reverse Shot, Oct. 12, 2022-Jan. 22, 2023, no cat.

Heidelberger Kunstverein, Marwa Arsanios: Matter of Alliances, Feb. 18-Apr. 16, 2023, no cat.

Screenings:

33e Festival International de Cinéma Marseille, July 5-11, 2022, no cat. no.

Berwick Film & Media Arts Festival, March 3-5, no cat.
provenance_text: The artist; sold through mor charpentier, Paris, to the Art Institute of Chicago, Apr. 11, 2023.

input: Who is Afraid of Ideology? Part 4: Reverse Shot
